nl.naturalis.oaipmh.api

Interface IResumptionTokenGenerator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ResumptionToken

    public interface IResumptionTokenGenerator
    Interface defining the capacity to compose a resumption token from the information in an OAIPMHRequest instance. This interface is here only for completeness. OAI repositories don't ever need to implement it, even if they store more and/or other information in a resumption token than the default implementation (in which case they would have to provide an implementation for IResumptionTokenParser). This is because, while REST layer does need to know how to parse a resumption token, generating one is left to the OAI repository itself. The REST layer doesn't need to know how the repository does this. Nevertheless, classes that implement IResumptionTokenParser should probably also implement IResumptionTokenGenerator (the default implementation does), because parsing a resumption token naturally mirrors generating one.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String compose(OAIPMHRequest request)
      Generate a resumption token for the request following the specified request.

    • Method Detail

      • compose

        String compose(OAIPMHRequest request)
        Generate a resumption token for the request following the specified request. For example, assuming the repository is configured to hand out 50 records per request and the specified request's record offset is 300, then a resumption token must be generated with a record offset of 350.
        Parameters:
        request -
        Returns:
